intro: Camphora neesii, commonly known as the Chinese camphor tree, is a large evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the樟科 (Lauraceae) family and is characterized by its aromatic, glossy leaves and fragrant wood. The plant is known for its ability to produce camphor, a volatile oil used in traditional medicine and as a natural preservative. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Camphora neesii plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
